questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: A yellow diamond-shaped sign is used to warn drivers about upcoming road conditions and hazards.

questions.question: The 'Slippery When Wet' sign is what shape and color?
questions.explanation: Warning signs like the 'Slippery When Wet' sign are usually yellow and diamond-shaped.

questions.question: What does a red circle with a slash through it mean?
questions.explanation: A red circle with a slash through it always means the action is prohibited.

questions.question: What does a green traffic light indicate?
questions.explanation: A green light signals that you may proceed if the intersection is clear.

questions.question: What does a flashing red traffic light mean?
options: Stop and yield the right-of-way before proceeding
The traffic light is out of order
questions.correctAnswer: Stop and yield the right-of-way before proceeding
questions.explanation: A flashing red light is treated the same as a stop sign. It means stop and then proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When two vehicles arrive at an intersection at the same time, who has the right of way?
options: The driver who is driving faster
Whichever driver is driving a larger vehicle
questions.explanation: At an intersection where there is no stop sign or traffic signal, drivers must yield to vehicles coming from the right.

questions.question: When merging onto a freeway, who has the right of way?
options: The vehicles already on the freeway
questions.correctAnswer: The vehicles already on the freeway
questions.explanation: When merging onto a freeway, you must yield to the traffic already on the freeway.

questions.question: When is it legal to overtake another vehicle?
options: When you are in an intersection
When you are on a hill or curve
When the vehicle is at a railroad crossing
When your lane is clear and it's safe to do so
questions.correctAnswer: When your lane is clear and it's safe to do so
questions.explanation: It's only legal to overtake another vehicle when your lane is clear ahead and it's safe to do so.

questions.question: What is the speed limit in a residential area, unless otherwise posted?
questions.explanation: The speed limit in a residential area is typically 25 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: When you see a school bus with its red lights flashing, what should you do?
options: Speed up to pass the bus
questions.explanation: When a school bus has its red lights flashing, drivers in both directions must stop until the lights stop flashing.

questions.question: Where is it illegal to park?
options: In front of a private driveway
Within 15 feet of a fire hydrant
questions.explanation: It is illegal to park in all of these places.

questions.question: When parking uphill with a curb, which way should your wheels be turned?
options: Either to the left or right
questions.explanation: When parking uphill with a curb, your wheels should be turned to the left (away from the curb).

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle starts to skid on a wet road?
options: Steer in the direction you want to go
Steer in the opposite direction of the skid
questions.correctAnswer: Steer in the direction you want to go
questions.explanation: If your vehicle starts to skid, stay calm and steer in the direction you want to go. Don't brake hard or jerk the wheel.

questions.question: When should you use your high beam headlights?
options: When driving in rural areas and no other vehicles are around
questions.correctAnswer: When driving in rural areas and no other vehicles are around
questions.explanation: High beams should be used in rural areas or on dark city streets when no other cars are around. They must be dimmed when other vehicles are within 500 feet.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle's gas pedal sticks and you cannot pull it up manually?
options: Shift into neutral and use the brakes to slow your vehicle
Speed up and look for a place to crash
questions.correctAnswer: Shift into neutral and use the brakes to slow your vehicle
questions.explanation: If your gas pedal sticks, shift into neutral and use the brakes to slow your vehicle. Turning off the ignition or applying the emergency brake could result in loss of control.
